entries.title: First-time buyer challenges minister over 10.4% mortgage offer
entries.description: A first-time buyer tells BBC One's Question Time four mortgage offers were withdrawn after market turmoil.

entries.title: Morocco demands Adidas changes Algeria football kit
entries.description: Adidas says an Algerian palace inspired the design, but Morocco says it is cultural appropriation.

entries.title: Cost of living: Energy bills set to rise but help cushions blow
entries.description: A two-year government-set cap means price rises taking effect on Saturday are lower than initially expected.

entries.title: US points finger at Russia over gas pipeline sabotage
entries.description: US Energy Secretary Jennifer Granholm tells the BBC its unlikely Nord Stream leaks are coincidence.

entries.title: The Papers: 'PM holds crunch talks' and benefits to be curbed
entries.description: Liz Truss's efforts to reassure the markets that she can control government spending lead the papers.

entries.title: Finland wants to transform how we make clothes
entries.description: Firms behind innovative fibres says they can make fashion a more sustainable business.

entries.title: King Charles: New coins featuring monarch's portrait unveiled
entries.description: Centuries of tradition are followed as King Charles faces left - the opposite way to the Queen.

entries.title: Cost of living tips: How to cut energy and heating costs in your home
entries.description: Consumer Affairs Correspondent Colletta Smith has picked out some of the best ways to cut costs in your home.

entries.title: Energy price cap: Three things to do before your bills rise
entries.description: Millions are seeing their energy bills go up, but there are ways to help ease the mounting costs.

entries.title: Olivia Pratt-Korbel: Murder arrest over Liverpool shooting
entries.description: A 34-year-old man is held on suspicion of murder after the killing of Olivia Pratt-Korbel.

entries.title: Liz Truss to attend first meeting of European nations club
entries.description: More than 40 leaders, including from all the EU states, were invited to discuss security and energy issues.

entries.title: Ukraine-Russia war: US army doctor and wife charged with Russia spying
entries.description: The army major doctor and her wife, a civilian doctor, are charged over plans to leak health information.

entries.title: Mini-budget: PM to meet head of OBR following market turmoil
entries.description: Liz Truss and the Chancellor Kwasi Kwarteng will meet the independent forecaster the OBR on Friday.

entries.title: Kwasi Kwarteng: We stopped consumer spending collapse
entries.description: Chancellor Kwasi Kwarteng says he will stick to his tax cut plan despite days of market turmoil.

entries.title: Everton 1-0 Leicester: Toffees beat Leicester with late own goal in WSL
entries.description: An own goal by goalkeeper Kirstie Levell deep in stoppage time gives Everton victory over Leicester City in the Women's Super League.

entries.title: Alfred Dunhill Links: Romain Langasque equals Old Course record to lead
entries.description: Romain Langasque says he will remember equalling the Old Course record to lead the Alfred Dunhill Links Championship "for the rest of my life".

entries.title: Transgender charity Mermaids under investigation
entries.description: The Charity Commission is investigating concerns over safeguarding.

entries.title: Rugby League World Cup: Jonny Lomax and Mark Percival ruled out of England squad
entries.description: St Helens duo Jonny Lomax and Mark Percival are ruled out of England's 24-man squad for the World Cup because of injury concerns.

entries.title: Men jailed for murder of friend killed by rival gang in shootout
entries.description: Jurors heard they fired knowing rivals would shoot back, in what is thought to be a landmark case.

entries.title: County Championship: Liam Norwell takes 9-62 as Warwickshire beat Hampshire to relegate Yorkshire
entries.description: Liam Norwell takes a stunning 9-62 as Warwickshire beat Hampshire by five runs to send Yorkshire down.

entries.title: West Brom women change shorts colour to navy because of period concerns
entries.description: West Bromwich Albion women will wear navy shorts because of concerns about having to wear white while on their periods.

entries.title: Liz Truss interviews: Five key exchanges with prime minister
entries.description: The PM's reaction was keenly awaited after a dramatic week which saw a mini-budget and the pound slump.

entries.title: Fact-checking Liz Truss on the economy
entries.description: The prime minister was asked about her plans during a series of BBC local radio interviews.

entries.title: Young non-smokers told not to take up vaping by experts
entries.description: But the findings do show that vaping is far safer than cigarettes, so smokers should switch.

entries.title: PGA Tour launches LIV Golf lawsuit counterclaim
entries.description: The PGA Tour launches a counterclaim lawsuit against the Saudi-backed LIV Golf series, saying it enticed players to breach contracts and help 'sportswash' the nation's human rights record.

entries.title: Rory McIlroy: World number two rejects criticism of caddie Harry Diamond
entries.description: Rory McIlroy strongly defends his caddie Harry Diamond, saying that their record together "speaks for itself".

entries.title: Quiz of the week: Whose crystal flute did Lizzo play?
entries.description: How closely have you been paying attention to what's been going on over the past seven days?

entries.title: Hurricane Ian - Maps and images showing destruction
entries.description: Visual guide to powerful Hurricane Ian, which has caused devastation in Cuba and Florida

entries.title: GCSE and A-level grades set to drop in England
entries.description: Exam results in 2023 will be much closer to pre-Covid levels after a boom in top grades, Ofqual says.

entries.title: Harry Dunn crash: US citizen appears in court
entries.description: Anne Sacoolas is accused of causing death by dangerous driving following a collision in 2019.

entries.title: Renee MacRae: Man found guilty of killing lover and son in 1976
entries.description: The bodies of Renee MacRae and her three-year-old son Andrew have never been found.

entries.title: Key moments as Liz Truss grilled by local radio
entries.description: Listen to some of the key moments from the prime minister’s first interviews since the mini-budget announcement.

entries.title: Perrie Edwards and Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain's home burgled
entries.description: Perrie Edwards and Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain were in the house when the break-in happened, police say.

entries.title: Windsor Castle: People travel hundreds of miles to say farewell to the Queen
entries.description: Hundreds of people queue outside Windsor Castle to see the final resting place of Queen Elizabeth II.

entries.title: Queen's cause of death given as 'old age' on death certificate
entries.description: The time and cause of her death have been revealed on her death certificate by Scottish authorities.

entries.title: Covid vulnerable not always assessed by NHS 111 early in pandemic
entries.description: A report from the health safety watchdog found the phone service could be improved for the future.

entries.title: How Gangsta's Paradise changed the course of hip-hop
entries.description: In 1995, Coolio combined street-tough lyrics with a pop sensibility - and rap wold never be the same.

entries.title: Arsenal's Gabriel Jesus, Gabriel Martinelli and Granit Xhaka rate each others' style choices
entries.description: Arsenal's Gabriel Jesus, Gabriel Martinelli and Granit Xhaka rate each others' style choices for MOTDx, as they accessorise the Gunners' new Caribbean-themed third kit.

entries.title: Paramore: We needed a break to find our identity
entries.description: Frontwoman Hayley Williams talks about returning to the stage and teases plans for a 2023 UK tour.

entries.title: Energy prices: Households turning to coal ahead of 'hard winter'
entries.description: One woman who made the switch says her coal bunker has been raided by a thief.

entries.title: Ukraine war: Finland closes border to Russian tourists
entries.description: It now means all of Russia's European Union neighbours have shut their borders to its tourists.

entries.title: Iran president says 'chaos' will not be accepted as protests continue
entries.description: Ebrahim Raisi vows to deal decisively with "rioters", as days of anti-government unrest continues.

entries.title: Danny Boyle's dance Matrix set for Manchester's £186m Factory arts venue
entries.description: The director's live version of the 1999 film will be among the first shows at Manchester's Factory.

entries.title: Dover summer queue warning under new EU border system
entries.description: Holidaymakers and lorries could face long queues under the changes, the Port of Dover's boss warns.

entries.title: Russia to formally annex four more areas of Ukraine
entries.description: Russia is to press ahead with annexation days after conducting unrecognised referendums.

entries.title: Striking barristers to vote on pay proposals
entries.description: Lawyers in England and Wales are to vote on whether to end a strike after a new offer from government.

entries.title: Car crushed by tractor in crash caught on CCTV at RAF Mildenhall
entries.description: Police say nobody was seriously injured in the incident outside an airbase.

entries.title: Tyson Fury calls on Anthony Joshua to sign fight contract by Thursday
entries.description: Tyson Fury urges fellow British heavyweight Anthony Joshua to sign a contract for a world-title fight in December.

entries.title: Next warns weaker pound could prolong cost of living pressures
entries.description: The retailer says many clothing and homeware factories price goods in dollars, so costs are likely to rise.

entries.title: Cancer charity boss put donations into Welsh dragon plan
entries.description: The foundation made no charitable donations by the time it closed, and the dragon was never built.

entries.title: MLB: 'See ya!' Judge hits record-equalling home run
entries.description: New York Yankees' Aaron Judge hits his 61st home run of the season to tie Roger Maris' 61-year-old American League record.

entries.title: England women to end 2022 against Japan and Norway
entries.description: European champions England will play their final two games of 2022 against Japan and Norway in November.

entries.title: Hurricane Ian: Cities flooded and power cut as storm crosses Florida
entries.description: Some 2.2 million homes are without electricity after 241km/h (150mph) winds tore down power lines.

entries.title: GFSN League: 20 years of LGBTQ+ league whose aim is not to exist
entries.description: The Gay Football Supporters' Network (GFSN) League celebrates its 20th anniversary - and has the eventual aim of not needing to exist.

entries.title: Nord Stream: Sweden finds new leak in Russian gas pipeline
entries.description: The EU says the leaks are caused by sabotage and promises the "strongest possible response".

entries.title: Why is the Bank of England buying government debt?
entries.description: The BBC's Economics Editor Faisal Islam explains why the Bank of England had to act.

entries.title: Government is undercutting institutions - Carney
entries.description: Former Bank of England Governor Mark Carney accused Downing Street of working at cross-purposes with the Bank.

entries.title: Erling Haaland's records - and the ones he could break as Man City face Man Utd
entries.description: Erling Haaland has already broken several records this season and there could be plenty more to come.

entries.title: House of Zana owner hopes Zara trademark win will inspire others
entries.description: Amber Kotrri says since her victory other businesses said they also received letters from Zara.

entries.title: Markets up after Bank of England bond-buying pledge
entries.description: The central bank said it will buy £65bn of government bonds after the mini-budget sparked market turmoil.

entries.title: Coolio: Gangsta's Paradise rapper dead at 59
entries.description: The artist's manager says he was found unresponsive in a friend's bathroom.

entries.title: Optus: How a massive data breach has exposed Australia
entries.description: Anger rises after 40% of Australians had details stolen in possibly the nation's worst-ever breach.

entries.title: Dogs can sniff out stress on owner's breath
entries.description: Four dogs successfully identified samples of sweat or breath taken from a stressed person.

entries.title: Big oil's toxic emissions from flaring undeclared
entries.description: BBC investigation finds oil companies not declaring millions of tonnes of emissions linked to cancer.

entries.title: Dying patient should have been seen in person
entries.description: A man died after four telephone consultations with his GP surgery but no face-to-face assessment.

entries.title: The long-misdiagnosed student heading to Cambridge to study medicine
entries.description: For years, Suffolk teenager Katy Shaw's symptoms were either misdiagnosed or not believed.

entries.title: Beware online car sale scams, consumers warned
entries.description: A fake car dealership website defrauded victims out of thousands of pounds, BBC investigation finds.

entries.title: Windsor Castle: Public can visit Queen's final resting place in St George's Chapel
entries.description: The Queen was buried with Prince Philip and alongside the remains of her father, mother and sister.

entries.title: Energy bills: Householders urged to read meters before October price rise
entries.description: The average annual household energy bill in the UK will rise from £1,971 to £2,500.
